com.robix.nexway
Interface NexusConnection

public interface NexusConnection

This interface provides access to a local or remote Robix Nexus application.

connect

public void connect()
             throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                    java.io.IOException,
                    RbxUnsupportedVersionException,
                    java.lang.InterruptedException,
                    java.lang.IllegalStateException
Attempts to connect to a remote Nexus application. If this method fails and throws an exception, the NexusConnection will not automatically retry the connection.

Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException - if the specified host cannot be found
java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs when connecting to the host (commonly occurs when host is found but remote Nexus application is not found)
RbxUnsupportedVersionException - if a remote Nexus was found, but it is incompatible
java.lang.InterruptedException - if another thread has interrupted the current thread. The interrupted status of the current thread is cleared when this exception is thrown.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if already connecting
See Also:
connectAsync()

connectAsync

public void connectAsync()
Begins connecting to a remote Nexus application asynchronously. Connection status can be monitored by using isConnected(), isConnecting(), getConnectionState(), and/or getLastConnectionError().

If auto-reconnect settings need to be changed, they should be changed before calling this method. By default:

  • auto-reconnect is enabled
  • auto-reconnect interval is set to 5 sec
  • auto-reconnect limit is set to 0 (infinite retries)

    • disconnect

    public void disconnect()
    Disconnects from the remote Nexus application. This method also disables auto-reconnect.

    getConnectionState

    public int getConnectionState()
    Returns the status of the connection.

    Possible return values are defined in ConnectState.

    Returns:
    the connection status

    getLastConnectionError

    public int getLastConnectionError()
    Returns the last error encountered when trying to establish a connection.

    Possible return values are defined in ConnectError.

    Returns:
    the last connection error

    isAutoReconnectEnabled

    public boolean isAutoReconnectEnabled()
    Determines if auto-reconnect is enabled.

    Returns:
    true if auto-reconnect is enabled; false otherwise

    setAutoReconnectEnabled

    public void setAutoReconnectEnabled(boolean enabled)
    Sets whether or not auto-reconnect is enabled.

    Auto-reconnect must be enabled in order to use connectAsync().

    If auto-reconnect is enabled, and the connection to the remote Nexus application is lost, an attempt is made to re-establish the connection. The connection will be re-tried periodically, depending on the auto-reconnect interval. The auto-reconnect limit determines how many re-tries are performed before giving up.

    Parameters:
    enabled - true to enable auto-reconnect; false to disable

    getAutoReconnectIntervalSec

    public int getAutoReconnectIntervalSec()
    Returns the auto-reconnect interval, in seconds.

    Returns:
    the auto-reconnect interval, in seconds.

    setAutoReconnectIntervalSec

    public void setAutoReconnectIntervalSec(int intervalSec)
    Sets the auto-reconnect interval, in seconds.

    Parameters:
    intervalSec - the auto-reconnect interval, in seconds; (must be a positive number)
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if intervalSec is <= 0

    getAutoReconnectLimit

    public int getAutoReconnectLimit()
    Returns the auto-reconnect limit.

    Returns:
    the auto-reconnect limit.

    setAutoReconnectLimit

    public void setAutoReconnectLimit(int limit)
    Sets the auto-reconnect limit.

    Parameters:
    limit - the auto-reconnect limit; set to 0 for infinite (must be non-negative)
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if limit is < 0

    getUsborCount

    public int getUsborCount()
    Returns the number of Usbor devices contained in the Nexus.

    Returns:
    the Usbor count

    getUsborByIndex

    public Usbor getUsborByIndex(int index)
    Returns the Usbor at the specified index in the Usbor list. Note that an Usbor's index may change at any time due to other Usbors being added/removed.

    This method, in conjunction with getUsborListMod(), could be used to iterate through all existing Usbors. However, an easier approach it to use getUsbors() to get a list of all known Usbors.

    Parameters:
    index - the Usbor index (zero-based)
    Returns:
    the specified Usbor, or null if the Usbor was not found

    getUsborByName

    public Usbor getUsborByName(java.lang.String usborName)
    Returns the Usbor with the specified name.

    Parameters:
    usborName - the Usbor name
    Returns:
    the specified Usbor, or null if the Usbor was not found

    getUsborBySerialNum

    public Usbor getUsborBySerialNum(java.lang.String serialNum)
    Returns the Usbor with the specified serial number.

    Parameters:
    serialNum - the serial number
    Returns:
    the specified Usbor, or null if the Usbor was not found

    getUsbors

    public Usbor[] getUsbors()
    Returns an array of all Usbors contained in the NexusConnection.

    Returns:
    an array of all Usbors contained in the NexusConnection.

    getUsborListMod

    public int getUsborListMod()
    Returns the modification number for the NexusConnection's Usbor list. This number is incremented every time a new Usbor is detected or an existing Usbor is removed.

    This function is typically used to determine if any new Usbors have appeared or any existing Usbors have disappeared.

    Returns:
    the Usbor list mod

    getCamCount

    public int getCamCount()
    Returns the number of Cam devices contained in the NexusConnection.

    Returns:
    the Cam count

    getCamByIndex

    public Cam getCamByIndex(int index)
    Returns the Cam at the specified index in the Cam list. Note that an Cam's index may change at any time due to other Cams being added/removed.

    This method, in conjunction with getCamListMod(), could be used to iterate through all existing Cams. However, an easier approach it to use getCams() to get a list of all known Cams.

    Parameters:
    index - the Cam index (zero-based)
    Returns:
    the specified Cam, or null if the Cam was not found

    getCamByName

    public Cam getCamByName(java.lang.String camName)
    Returns the Cam with the specified name.

    Parameters:
    camName - the Cam name
    Returns:
    the specified Cam, or null if the Cam was not found

    getCams

    public Cam[] getCams()
    Returns an array of all Cams contained in the NexusConnection.

    Returns:
    an array of all Cams contained in the NexusConnection.

    getCamListMod

    public int getCamListMod()
    Returns the modification number for the NexusConnection's Cam list. This number is incremented every time a new Cam is detected or an existing Cam is removed.

    This function is typically used to determine if any new Cams have appeared or any existing Cams have disappeared.

    Returns:
    the Cam list mod

    getRepName

    public java.lang.String getRepName()
    Returns the name of the peer object (the Rep) to which this NexusConnection is connected.

    Returns:
    the Rep's name

    getRepLocation

    public java.lang.String getRepLocation()
    Returns the location of the NexusConnection's peer. e.g. "127.0.0.1"

    Returns:
    the connection location

    getRepResponseTimeMs

    public int getRepResponseTimeMs()
    Returns the average reponse time (aka ping time) of the NexusConnection's peer. This is the amount of time it takes a message to make a round trip, to the peer and back again.

    Returns:
    the average response time (in milliseconds) of the peer

    getNexusVersion

    public java.lang.String getNexusVersion()
    Returns the version of the Nexus application to which this object is connected.

    Returns:
    the Nexus application's version
